website_summaries.verdict: A reliable starter kit for beginners to use while learning the ins and outs of router techniques, more experienced users will appreciate having a wide selection of bits for occasional projects.
pros: Tungsten carbide bits work reliably with appropriate projects, and cut well
Several experienced users were surprised by how well they held up when properly cared for
cons: Reports of bits snapping after just a few feet of use
Will burn wood surface if used at too high rpm, which isn’t unusual for router bits

customer_reviews.title: because they aren't anywhere near as good as my Freud bits that I have
customer_reviews.text: These Router Bits are a bargin! I was going to rate them 4 stars, because they aren't anywhere near as good as my Freud bits that I have, but I am a beginner woodworker and these are a great starter set of bits to get me used to using my router and give me versatility while being affordable. I have been using this set for about 2 months now and all the bits I've used so far have worked great. I bought the set so I could see which bits I would use most often and replace them one by one with better bits individually.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P. Silvestri

customer_reviews.title: Only cost a few more bucks to first class (or even exit row)
customer_reviews.text: The bits are low quality. The first time I used the 1/4” bit it broke off. I then switched to the 1/2” and the blade was worn really bad. I made sure to go slow with it but it didn’t matter. I would recommend spending a few more bucks for bits that will actually last.
customer_reviews.author: Aaronp123

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Pulled out my bits set today to edge a piece of 5.5" x 23" popular wood. After the first 23 inches on the router, I noticed just about in the middle of the second edge the bit was not cutting the wood cleanly. A mental note was made that I would have to come back over the edge with the sander to clean it up. Both short ends of the boards (5.5 inch) were burnt and also did not have clean cuts. The first bit used in this set was now worthless. My set of bits were collected and tossed in the trash. Don't waste your money....You truly get what you pay for. 15 bits for $20...........what was I thinking?
customer_reviews.author: Arrinwapinhead

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They will probably get you through a small project and are inexpensive. Cons: The straight bit broke after just a few cuts in MDF. The trim bit gets gummed up with the glue from the veneer I was trimming which made the trim more and more uneven. I'd have to stop and scrape the glue off after each pass. I think this is due to the type of paint that is on these bits as this doesn't happen with a more expensive bit I bought. keep a can of spray lubricant nearby for the bearings.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bits
customer_reviews.text: I'm relatively new at wood-working, and these are the first bits that I used with my new router. I broke the first one and lightly scorched a 2x4 during the initial phase. After that, even I was impressed by how smoothly they cut the grooves. I just ordered the larger set.
customer_reviews.author: W. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed my project
customer_reviews.text: Used a straight bit for the first time out of the box. Did well for the first past. Completely tore up the wood on the second pass and ruined the project that I had been working on. Switched back over to my old "dull" bits and tested them out on the same type of wood. Worked fine. Put the new bits in the router and tried it again. Destroyed that piece of wood. You do get what you pay for when it comes to tools but even cheaper tools should at least last for one small project.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan W. Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: It’s rated for 2500 and I used 2300. The thing exploded hitting me in the face and broke my router.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPLY MADE AND PACKAGED BITS BROKE THE IRST USE SENT ...
customer_reviews.text: CHEAPLY MADE AND PACKAGED BITS BROKE THE IRST USE SENT IT BACK
customer_reviews.author: KrashHack

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: I have not used yet but these appear to be decently made and should work for my purposes. Although the wooden case they come in was falling apart at the seams when I received it. No shipping box damage apparent but it could have been dropped and split it open inside without really damaging the outer carton. I might recommend some padding in the packaging as the box is great to keep them organized. Nothing a little gorilla glue can't fix
customer_reviews.author: John J. Voss

customer_reviews.title: Smallest bit snapped after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Bit snapped in two halfway through it's first run. I had to step up to the larger 1/4 inch bit to route a simple inlay for a drawer. Until I hear from the manufacturer, I would NOT recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Gmtidwell

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Horrible cheaply made bits. Got a brand new router and these bits and it burned the wood and they were so dull.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal5Hortons

customer_reviews.title: Go gently
customer_reviews.text: Fine for very light duty, laminates and fly cuts but otherwise you get what you pay for. I tried a gentle plunge cut and had to back out repeatedly. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: jason a gaudreau

customer_reviews.title: Getting what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few bits with great success. Time will tell how they hold up. When it came time to do some "detail" work I went with the straight 1/4" bit....snapped in half after 15 or so seconds. I then had to use the 1/2" straight bit to complete a small/quick project for my nephew - worked out "ok". I use tools with care and understand limitations. This shouldn't have gone south under the conditions. I've since bought a single bit for about as much as this whole kit went for. No problems. I'm happy with the other bits I've used.
customer_reviews.author: a. Syverson

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy box.  Bits worked great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a single project but I'll probably use them again. Used 5/8" bit to cut 49' of dado groove in oak plywood for bookcase pilasters. Never used a router before but found an old 25,000 rpm Craftsman router at the thrift store. Then used the flush bearing bit to shave 25' of oak nosing board. Nice sharp cuts. Router ran as fast on the last cut as on the first - so bits are probably still sharp. The case is flimsy so if you plan to use it twice, glue the shelves back in and cover the labels with clear packaging tape so they don't blow away.
customer_reviews.author: El Kati

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: While yes its true, you can buy better quality for twice the price. This set is very well worth the money. I have used the ogee, the round over, chamfer and the cove bit extensively . I have already recommended this set to friends and family, and I would buy it again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.author: V T Flores

customer_reviews.title: Okay as a starter set
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to using a router and wanted a basic set of bits to get me going. They are okay and the cove bit did the job on a small pine side table I was making. I can see that these bits are not top quality and will be replacing them as I need to with better bits. That was to be expected for the the price. You obviously are not going to get 15 bits that are as high quality as ones you spend close to the same price for one. I am generally happy with them and they will let me experiment with different cuts before branching into a proper collection.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: good! if you're looking to trim crust off bread
customer_reviews.text: trimmer bit spun the guide wheel off after 2 minutes of use (trimming 1/8" vinyl tile). roman ogee managed to complete the little task it had, but guide wheel on that one too has become unreliable. you get what you pay for... if you're planning to get a lot of use from these bits better invest in quality router bits because these are cheap, poorly made and too suspenseful as to whether or not every time you use one you'll be able to complete the task.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive bit collection that works great for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a few router bits for a small project and this set was perfect. Inexpensive and lots of bit options for what I needed now and what I might want in the future. Will these bits last as long as more expensive brand name pieces? Are they are sharp and are they to the tight tolerances that professionals demand? I don't know. I do know that the bits I used worked for my simple needs and I didn't break the bank on a $60 single bit.
customer_reviews.author: Not the droid you're looking for

customer_reviews.title: Great value, butcher block project.
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome deal, i am a brand new diy woodworking novice, i made my first hardwood butcher block and wanted to add a juice groove and edge, i dont have a lot of money and this product was the best value, a variety of bits with a picture of what each bit does for a novice like me thats great. They worked great with the ryobi router i also bought in the same order, super fast shipping completed this process. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: kenpo saber

customer_reviews.title: Mostly as expected
customer_reviews.text: This is my first set of router bits and I'm a novice at using a router. That said, I'm happy with the few bits I've used with one exception - one bit, the half inch straight bit - has a shaft that looks to the eye like the others but will not fit into the router as do the others. Some bits I've used fit more snugly than others - so I'd say there's a quality issue.
customer_reviews.author: dscotrobin

customer_reviews.title: Very small router bits
customer_reviews.text: Look close because I don't recall noticing that they are really small bits sized for a trim router. I got them because I thought the price was too good to miss. I pay a premium for the bits I use a lot and this was going to be backup stuff. They are too small for a standard router but work fine on my small Bosch trim router.
customer_reviews.author: frequent user

customer_reviews.title: Great variety and quality
customer_reviews.text: I found this set on some other site that only does reviews. It was a top rated set and compared to other sets from that review I’m amazed at how inexpensive it is. Especially when you consider all the different styled pieces you get. I use these with a cordless Bosch 12v edge router and for the ability of the tool, these bits perform great.
customer_reviews.author: Shoboy

customer_reviews.title: overall great beginner set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because I am a beginner at using a router. This set comes with all of the bits I would need and they are sharp and seem to be well made. The wooden box them come in is ok but the only thing I don't like is the plastic inserts that the bits fit into come out of the box when you remove a bit to use. I wish the plastic sleeve inserts would have been secured inside the box. Now I will have to glue them down. But overall I am happy with the set.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Young

customer_reviews.title: Broke during the first use
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. Used the 1/4" straight bit to cut a dado in some poplar wood and it broke during the 5th cut. Only 3/16" deep and this happened. Not sure that I even want to try the other bits.
customer_reviews.author: D. Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this without much of an expectation. I was very much pleasantly surprised when I got it. Not only was the wooden box light weight and more durable than I need it, it all worked like a charm! I never had a burn on my trims anymore and it cuts the wood awesomely. It even made my $25 Harbor Freight trim router almost not make mistakes... which is saying a lot. One downside is that it is rather hard to remove the bits from the holders in the wooden box... but if you use a pliers or something you'll never hurt yourself.
customer_reviews.author: jghost

customer_reviews.title: Good started set for your router
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a good set of router bits. Not the same quality as the name brand bits, but I can buy a whole set of these for cheaper than a single name brand bit. This gives me a good selection, if I wear one of these out I can upgrade to a better one, but these should do fine for starting out.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: starter kit
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a starter kit and all the bits are fine. my problem is that I've started using the router more I've noticed this really doesn't have some of the bits I would consider core. I've had to buy several side bits to try and complete the collection and found that I endedup spending more than if I had just bought a more complte kit at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Good starter set
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this as a starter set of bits for my new router and table, just to get an idea of the kinds of bits I'd use going forward. I've only used a couple of the bits so far, and they work well. I can't speak to the longevity, but the corner rounding I did went swimmingly. It's not a bad investment at this price if you don't know exactly what you want to do with your router. Once you pick out some favorite bits, then you can go spend $30 a piece on some nicer ones. Otherwise, this has some great variety and will power through some light woodwork.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: The bits arrived promptly in a very nice wooden box with a latch. They are very sharp and I look forward to using them. The bits included in the set are all your basic bits that one may need for small projects. Excellent for a beginner. I will update my review after they've gotten some miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: Anissa

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Half of the Bits have bigger diameter at the base and not fit the Router. After I ask for refund, Amazon show message I will get refund money as gift card to may account in couple hours after scan of defective item in UPS. Now week later they received the item and no refund. They told me they have two week to return the money. Before in case like this money was returned to me right away. Looks like new policy, be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Quality
customer_reviews.text: I finally had a project for my new router bits. I was using the 1/8th inch bit, slowly cutting a 1/4 inch deep channel through plywood. The bit broke just as I started the 4th sheet. And I’m past the return date. The price really was too good to be true. Unable to find any manufacturer contact info, and Walmart has the same set, at a few dollars cheaper since I won’t have to pay shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: It was surprisingly hard to find a bit set with a detail router bit like the 1/8". I was doing cursive on a sign and needed a small bit like that so I'm very pleased with it! This kit is cheaper than just buying a single bit at my local hardware store so I was ecstatic about the price too. Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel J

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cut, useless
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a Bosch Router with Bosch Router Table. Purchased this set of bits as my first set to get started and had disappointing results. Used two bits to try out and got poor cuts. See images. Also shank is 1/4 diameter which I missed in product description (burried). Given its a cheap entry level bit set, it should be able to do at least when new. I am returning this product to buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: HQ

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I don’t give it a five star it’s because I haven’t used it yet. It arrived on time and the package it’s exactly as pictured, it looks like it has good quality. It’s also a little smaller than I thought but definitely it will serve its purpose on my workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalinda Chavez Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Looks like decent router bits
customer_reviews.text: It arrived damaged. The wooden case broken. I didnt purchase it for the wooden box but even still better care should have been used by USPS. It seems no one even cares anymore about customer service. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Richard Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great set for someone looking to get into wood working
customer_reviews.text: Great set for someone looking to get into wood working. These are perfect for starting out and it's nice to have all of the bits to play around with. They might not last me for years, but they are perfect for the random project here and there. Plus you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: T-town

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and durable. I used the Roman Ogee bit exclusively and routed a beautiful edge on hard Maple. It looked beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mack

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used all the bits but the roundover sure works great. Used it on 200 feet of handrail on my deck and it cut a very smooth radius on the corners of the 2x6s. If all the bits are of the same quality then I will be happy with purchase. Can't rate the bits for durability as I haven't used all of them and haven't had them for a very long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this set.
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a pretty good deal. I am new into woodworking and I found this to be a much cheaper investment for me since I don't do this for a living and I dont work with these everyday, Dont think twice buy it you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: M.Z

customer_reviews.title: A great selection of small size bits: Very durable and precise
customer_reviews.text: I have used several of these bits for the past couple of weeks and have been very impressed with the durability and quality. I would categorize these as being for small woodworking or fine work as the bits are about 1/2 the size of my "furniture size" bits. No problem with that AND indeed much better for fine work.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Grove

customer_reviews.title: Smallest bit broke, Nice Wooden box though...
customer_reviews.text: The smallest bit broke off shortly after using. Not sure if it was user error or just way to brittle. I bought a different brand to replace it and that one is still going strong. Nice wooden box and easy to see pictures to know what the bit does. I probably wouldn't order it again just because the bits don't seem as durable as they should be.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have used only the 45 deg Chamfer bit so far and it has performed well. Used it on 100+ ft of pressure trated 2x wood for fascia and it is still fairly sharp. Satisfied and recommend it. Just taking one star off 'cause the assortment could be better with a couple more of flush trim bits.
customer_reviews.author: Zinn_Chomsky_Seeger

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice set, only used the 1/4 inch dado bit and burned it putting a dado groove in oak. That could have been my fault running at too high of an rpm, it went through one 5 foot length fine but wouldn't finish the second length. bought a second bit at my local hardware store and finished the job but I ran the new bit slower.
customer_reviews.author: ReaP

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used it when I built my decorative bench at the backyard. I have no problem with it. The product is okay.
customer_reviews.author: pdeltax

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: First time i used 1 of these bits broke and flew across room. Not that i am a master craftsman by any means but i do have a small woodshop. When that bit broke it could have done some serious damage to me or anyone in my shop. How it missed me i will never know. I chucked these in a drawer where they have been ever since. I vowed to never buy cheap bits again. It would have been 1 thing to leave a rough edge but these bits are deadly.
customer_reviews.author: beth knigge

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set for the beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this set for my husband's birthday. He is retired and is beginning a new hobby...woodworking and small furniture making. He was very pleased with this set of router bits and I was very pleased with the storage box it came in. My husband has a hard time keeping up with the small things in his shop!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley S., Lynnville, TN

customer_reviews.title: budget router bits
customer_reviews.text: Balanced well enough, sharp enough, good variety. For crying out loud people, it's a BUDGET set of router bits. If you want something fancy, go pay for it!! If you need them to work every day for ten years, pay for it!!! If you are like me and just want to fiddle around with molding and frames, can't go wrong with these. Shipping was super fast, bits were packed well. If I were to complain, I'd say they fit too snugly in the box and that the part of the box they are mounted it doesn't pivot like my old set did, so it's a PITA to get them out. Other than that, meets expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Richmond II

customer_reviews.title: Dull out quickly! Astonishingly quick.
customer_reviews.text: The first bit I used dulled so fast I thought I was imagining it. Then I realized the cut became rough and started to burn the wood. These bits are not worth the time. My bad for going cheap. Invest in a quality set and avoid the headache of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Sauce Rick

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a few bits to have on hand when I do projects. I don't do anything 'fancy', so these were okay. not the best bits, but for the price well worth it. one of the bits has a small nick, so it needs some clean up on the wood after cutting, so I gave it 4 stars. but I would recommend them, and I would buy them again
customer_reviews.author: mjl

customer_reviews.title: If you don’t plan to use them often, go for it.
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t exactly the best quality items if you are looking to use them often. I ended up buying these for my mother in law and then bought her a better brand the week after. If you don’t use them a lot they do the job though!
customer_reviews.author: keb536045

customer_reviews.title: Broken case box
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the router bits are OK quality but they shipped them inside the router case and the heavy weight of the tools have broken up the inside case wood mounts for the bits. Now the storage case is destroyed . Bits should have been wrapped so they would not move inside of the wooden box.
customer_reviews.author: rodney robbins

customer_reviews.title: Okay bits, but measurements are off
customer_reviews.text: The bits themselves are decent for being such a low cost set. However, the 1/2" straight bit actually measured .478", which makes it useless to use with 1/2" router bushing since the channel is too small. Hoping that it was just a manufacturing defect, I replaced the set with another set and the 1/2" bit measured exactly the same, so I suspect that they will all be off.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Klein

customer_reviews.title: Price is right!
customer_reviews.text: Get this if you are a beginner. It is great for practice. Don't expect this product to last long. As the say goes, "you get what you paid for". I like this product. I used all the bits and I don't feel bad if they get broken or gets dull quickly. For me, I think this is not the kind of bits you can keep using for a long period of time. Again, I highly recommend this for the beginner or for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: krazy_Papi

customer_reviews.title: Great bits for DIYs.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for 4 star review is the tip of the buts which aren't equal on both sides of the bit. they are sharp and I used them on Walnut, red oak and pines without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan F

customer_reviews.title: Can do a lot better for just a few bucks more
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the quality. Some bits are visibly defective and the box already fell apart after opening it twice. Used 2 of the bits and the finished product did not look good at all. They do work but if you care about clean edges and getting value for your money, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but bits break easily, so for occasional use only.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's really not bad for occasional use. The metal used to make the shaft is very brittle the narrow and more delicate bits tend to snap. Going slow is a must. The carbide cutting blades are milled nicely and don't leave any marks on wood and the roller bearings seems to handle up to occasional use. None of the bearings have seized yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: One of the bearings felt like it was going to seize on the first use, packaging was very cheap and some edges weren’t sharp at all. Can’t say I’m entirely surprised at the price point but still.
customer_reviews.author: P Kolb

customer_reviews.title: Good set of inexpensive bits, case is questionable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very reasonably priced router bit set. Unfortunately the hinges on the case they come in broke right away which makes storage a bit of a pain, but the bits themselves work as you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Meets or exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have used only a couple bit since I bought the set but booth bits worked well. I wish they were a bit sharper as the bit trimmer did heat up enough to cook the paint off, but I was taking a lot of materiel off in one pass and we are talking about a set of 15 bits I paid for in peanuts
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Good for a wood working beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great for a beginner. I don’t believe these to be tools you’ll be passing on to your children, but I’m just getting into wood working and learning how to use a router. I’ve done quite a bit so far since I purchased these a few months back and they seem to be holding up well. Mostly used on pine. Also the storage box they come in is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the price. This item was recommended by many people on several YouTube videos so I decided to buy. However, first time using it, my 1/4 straight piece broke. This will be the main piece I need to use so I ended up getting a high quality 1/4 piece at Home Depot to replace it. Hopefully the other pieces will hold up. I won’t use them as often .
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: A good set of tips.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to routing. But already, having a router has made a lot of my home projects a breeze. The box is simple but nice. Every tip is marked nice. They work well. I haven’t used them extensively yet, but from what I have used, I am very satisfied with the results. I have no regrets about buying this set and I look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Porras

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while. I think from now on I will just buy the bit I need instead of a box full of bits that most of which I will never use. The littlest bit broke off as soon as I tried to use it.
customer_reviews.author: FL

customer_reviews.title: These bits are a good value
customer_reviews.text: This router bit set arrived in a useful case. None have failed, despite a lot of use. I have even routed through a few screw heads without chipping the carbide. I recommend this set highly.
customer_reviews.author: alf randell

customer_reviews.title: Quality control is lacking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with a new Triton router. Wish I had not. The bearings on two bits have begun to fail after one use. Thw bits are all over-sized enough that they have to be persuaded both in, and out, of my router's collett. I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Vicent

customer_reviews.title: They are worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: They seem to work ok so far. I am not expecting to get a silk purse from a sows ear. For the amount that I spent on this I am happy with just the box. But really, with what a set like this cost at a big box hardware, even if I use each only once then I got my money's worth. If you need a more professional set I am sure they will sell you the sets that are a couple of hundred bucks.
customer_reviews.author: DStarr

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive. Durable. Great starter bits.
customer_reviews.text: The box storage is really neat. Inexpensive starter bits who's just starting to get into woodworking. Also, helps you decide of what design that you prefer the most without breaking a bank of buying expensive bits and come to realize you don't like it. I can't wait to try them all.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: works well. A few slipinterings but that may just be from the wood. Very happy for the value but the box they come in feels a bit flimsy and won't hold up through the years.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: A very solid value for light users.
customer_reviews.text: I like these bits. They are priced quite low but actually work well for my occasional needs. I tried on Douglas fir and does a decent job. I have not tried on hardwoods, but for me this is quite a variety of bits for a very affordable price. The bits are arranged nicely in a wooden box with clear visual tags of how the bits correspond to the final product when used. I think this is a great set for beginners and home DIY users with occasional work to be done. 1/4 inch shank.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: checked them and they are fine. Only thing was they had been packaged at ...
customer_reviews.text: just arrived today, checked them and they are fine. Only thing was they had been packaged at manufacture in the wooden box provided-upside down. I had to remove a piece of backing, and reverse things, then was happy. LOL Bad news is, my router died finally after 5 years of 'retirement hobby work'. LOL, I know where first place to look for new router!
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much but man these were pretty amazing, they r made well and love the case they come in
customer_reviews.author: rroswell1

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: have not used all of these yet, but the quality seems to be good. I like the display case for ease of knowing which bit does what.. Good presentation of product. I have not had them very long, so cannot confirm durability
customer_reviews.author: Migwriter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product  ! fair price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router bit set , the chamfer bit paid for itself, routed cherry and other hard wood and had no issues.. the other bits work fine too. Especially good for a Diy er.
customer_reviews.author: sunnysam

customer_reviews.title: Received on time but I haven’t use them yet.
customer_reviews.text: Receive these yesterday and they do look like their quality for what I paid for. I’ll follow up with a message after I’ve use them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: 1/8 bit snapped after 20 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I’m only 20 minutes into the 1/8 inch straight bit and just routing pine...and it snaps off on an easy pass going with the grain. Wth???
customer_reviews.author: Chad D. Laibly

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of router bits! I’ve only used the chamfer and ogee bits so far but they cut right through hardwood and the bearing doesn’t bind up like another set I’ve bought before. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Koczrowski

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bits.
customer_reviews.text: The bits are fairly good. I like them they cut well and do not burn wood. The box however was destroyed upon arrival. The display was glued inside and had released. Four bits were just laying in a pile. I would have preferred the shanks just jammed into foam.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Cavender

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I tried couple of times and every time the bits not securely fit my routers. I am not happy never used until than.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set
customer_reviews.text: A great set to get started with, several types of edge and groove cuts, and a flush bit. If your not sure what your looking for this is an inexpensive set to start with, and it’s lasted well through several projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I use my router a lot, but not so much that I need a set where the individual bits cost the same as this kit. Great stater set. When I know what bits I use most and these wear out I can purchase those bits individually.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive alternative to name brand sets
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this router bit set other than feels like quality items. All the bits came nice and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great bits! Don't think, buy
customer_reviews.text: I have used the mess out of these and lately on some of the hardest woodd I have ever worked with. The type stuff that wears a saw blade out in just a few cuts and these things have routed about a mile a this type decking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: You get what u pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It is cheaper, and comes in a neat little case that matches such. One row was broken of when I opened it, but it really didn't bother me. Haven't put the bits through there paces yet, and that is really what matters. Expect a revised review.
customer_reviews.author: Dickk

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: Nice set in nice wooden box, but not durable, first use, the shaft broke on the 1/4” straight bit, after only about 6” of use, had to go out and buy a good bit to finish job. I have been using routers and power tools for 50 some years, don’t recall a bit failing so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router Bit Assortment
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Well thought out assortment. Quality bits.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Fabricatore

customer_reviews.title: Not what’s pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Set did not come with a case. Each bit came in a small plastic box. I will post a picture later.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.. I hope
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money! I don't expect these to last forever, but they are getting the job done for now. As long as they don't break off and hit me in the face causing me to go to the hospital because I have a hole in my face, I'll continue to like them.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The bits look great and I am sure they would work for the right router. When buying which what size shank you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: 1/8" bit broke within few min of usage
customer_reviews.text: I used 1/8" bit on a oak board and was very careful. The bit broke withing few minutes of use. Will post more updates after I try other bits. Now after 1 use the 1/4" bit broke
customer_reviews.author: Ram Sunkara

customer_reviews.title: Works okay for DIY
customer_reviews.text: Not professional grade, but works okay for DIY with small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mac3rk

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre quality
customer_reviews.text: Works but not for very long. The bits dull quickly and I had my straight edge bit break on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Dislike, would not fit in my Bauer 1/4 in router, not universal.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Page

customer_reviews.title: Looks ok
customer_reviews.text: The bits look good, but I have not used them yet.
customer_reviews.author: J Lock

customer_reviews.title: 1 has failed so far, others seem ok
customer_reviews.text: These seemed ok otherwise- used other bits on a few edges, tried to use this bit to cut a groove where another piece of wood would slide in (for a tray) and it bent. Poplar and I was l not pushing on it very hard - just let it go through slowly. Got these a while back and I guess this is the first real test I gave them.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Used a couple out it so far for a bench, a bat house, and a butterfly house. All cut well and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Holt

customer_reviews.title: good turn
customer_reviews.text: I like them for what i do they work great for small jobs
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Viner

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Weak quality with large router. broke first time I used halfway down a 4' board! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: E.ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: A single bit costs $20 at Home Depot. I can't say how long these will last, but so far they've been great and for a fraction of the price of anything else. Bang for buck these can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Love

customer_reviews.title: It'll do, pig.
customer_reviews.text: They're not the sharpest or the sturdiest. If you're not careful (eg: if you don't block out your project appropriately) you'll get some serious tearout. But hey, they're sufficient for a cheap starter set. Have no doubt though - if you find you're using your router a lot, you're going to upgrade from these. And if you're already a regular woodworker, you should probably be looking at a better set than this.
customer_reviews.author: Josefek

customer_reviews.title: Def worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice set, price is right, cant complain so far, I am loving it!! I do not know how it will hold up through out the years in regards to sharpness but I also am not a carpenter or anything of the such and this is more for stuff around the house. First time using it for something was for wheel barrel handles!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.BLB

product_meta.title: Hiltex 10100 Tungsten Carbide Router Bits | 15-Piece Set
product_meta.description: Size:15 Piece| Color:BlueSolid carbide flush trim. " With Ball Bearing: Flush Trim Bit: 1/2"" Corner Round Bit：3/4"" 45DegreeChamfer Bit: 1/2"" Cove Bit：1/2"" Roman Ogee Bit：5/16"" ".
feature_bullets: Precisely machined sharp YG8 tungsten carbide blade makes clean and accurate cuts on all types of wood with excellent resistance to heat
Hardened solid alloy steel main construction with power coating finish for durability and longevity
Enclosed bearing roller for smooth and aligned operations with 1/4 inch universal shank fits all models of routers
Comes with wooden index case for easy storage and organization
Perfect for edging, trimming, veining and grooving in all woodworking projects for both professional carpenters and hobbyists

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,866 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
